snippet: In his first news conference in eight months, President Obama signaled he would grapple with Republicans over tax rates and the handling of the attack on Americans in Benghazi.
abstract: Pres Obama fields questions in his first formal news conference in eight months; signals that he is prepared to battle with Republicans over budget negotiations, defends his national security team's handling of the deadly attack on American mission in Benghazi, Libya, and addresses adultery scandal that brought down CIA director David H Petraeus.

byline.contributor: Annie Lowrey and Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In his first news conference in eight months, President Obama signaled he would grapple with Republicans over tax rates and the handling of the attack on Americans in Benghazi.

headline.seo: Obama Details Battle Lines in Budget Plan
headline.main: Obama Details Lines of Battle in Budget Plan, and on Libya
headline.print_headline: Obama Details Lines of Battle In Budget Plan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
